ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became much more comfortable speaking my native tongue and learning more about the hispanic community here at Yale.
I learned about grammar, communication skills, and so much more. This classes really helped improve my Spanish skills
I learned how to improve my Spanish after not having taking it formally since my first year of high school. I learned how to communicate my ideas clearly in Spanish.
My Spanish improved by a lot, and my grammatical skills were sharpened.
Improved native Spanish skills through grammar exercises, essays, class discussions, and quizzes.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength is definitely the instructor. She was wonderful, informative, challenging and fair.

Strengths: Variety of options given each week for assignments, engaged professor.
Weaknesses: evaluating the pandemic while it was happening, since that was our semester-long project, repetitiveness of weekly assignments (except towards the end)

Profesora Alexandrov is incredible. She is patient, understanding, and an amazing person and professor. Each lesson is carefully planned and catered to the class' needs, which helps us practice what we need to work on. It is a very fast-paced course (for we have a lot to cover throughout the semester) but I still was able to learn and retain a lot of information!
Professor Alexandrov is amazing and the course is very organized! No weaknesses for me.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, its a very engaging class
Yes, if you want to practice your Spanish!!!
Absolutely! Professor Alexandrov is a great instructor, and my Spanish skills really improved over the course of the semester.
Absolutely. Professor Alexandrov truly cares about you and your learning.
Yes. I feel that my comfort level with Spanish (outside of a home setting) is much higher.
